definition: to leave some leeway/to allow for the unpredictable
old variant of 留[liu2]
to leave (a message etc)/to retain/to stay/to remain/to keep/to preserve
old variant of 留[liu2]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
surname Yu
(archaic) I/me/variant of 餘|余[yu2], surplus
earth/ground/field/place/land/CL:片[pian4]
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct

sentences.english: Be sure there’s spaces between things, so you’re not rushed.
sentences.chinese: 要确保每件事之间都留有余地，这样你就不会太匆忙。

sentences.english: When arranging our work, we should allow for unforeseen circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 我们安排工作时要留有余地。

sentences.english: It was Howell’s own sense of limits that saved him.
sentences.chinese: 恰恰是豪厄尔这种留有余地的做法救了他。

sentences.english: One of the key tenets of the Dojo is the idea of leaving some margin.
sentences.chinese: 道教的主要信条之一讲的是做事留有余地。

sentences.english: When making commitments, it's best to under-promise and over-deliver.
sentences.chinese: 做出承诺的时候，最好留有余地，然后出色完成。

definition: to leave room to maneuver/to leave a margin for error
to leave oneself a way out
leeway/latitude/room for freedom of action
to go to extremes/to leave no room for maneuver
to stop before going too far (idiom); to stop while one can/don't overdo it/stop while you're ahead
to touch on sth and leave it there/to take care not to overdo sth
margin/leeway
everything
propriety/appropriate behavior/proper speech or action/within the norms
free to come and go (idiom)/to have room to maneuver
think three times then go (idiom); don't act before you've thought it through carefully
think again and again before acting (idiom); consider carefully in advance
too far is as bad as not enough (idiom, from the Analects)
where it is possible to let people off, one should spare them (idiom); anyone can make mistakes, forgive them when possible
pinyin: de2 rao2 ren2 chu4 qie3 rao2 ren2

definition: to advance or retreat/knowing when to come and when to leave/a sense of propriety
to hold back a trick/not to divulge all one's trade secrets
